Fix options: (1) Have buddy watch PTY output directly for activity signals (regex on terminal output), (2) Have the Tauri Rust backend emit hw-tool-summary based on file watcher activity instead of relying on MCP push, (3) Both -- MCP push for HW-aware projects, file watcher fallback for others.

tasks.title: Bug: App ignores launch directory, always uses stale projectPath from ~/.hello-world-app.json
tasks.description: When Pat runs `npx tauri dev` from the hello-world directory, the app loads whatever projectPath is stored in ~/.hello-world-app.json instead of using the current working directory. This caused the app to load tax-credit-calculators data even though it was launched from hello-world. Root cause: get_app_project_path() (lib.rs:101) reads from the JSON config unconditionally. set_app_project_path() (lib.rs:109) only gets called from the Settings UI. The app never checks std::env::current_dir() on startup. Fix: On Tauri app init, check if CWD contains a .hello-world/ directory. If yes, use CWD as projectPath and update the config file. If no, fall back to the stored config. This ensures launching from a project directory always wins over stale config. Related: t_mp_mcp_fix, t_mp_switcher.

tasks.description: Three guardrails to prevent lazy consensus in deliberations: (1) Coverage gate -- track numbered sub-questions from the framing, verify each gets substantive treatment before synthesis. (2) Mediator intervention rule -- when an agent dismisses a topic without engaging its specific value prop, Claude pauses the round and redirects. (3) Randomize or rotate agent speaking order per round so no single agent always anchors the frame. Implementation: these are behavioral rules for Claude as mediator, but could also be encoded as a pre-synthesis checklist in the deliberation flow.

tasks.title: Buddy startup recap: summarize last session context in chat bubble
tasks.description:
Hybrid approach (decided with Pat):

1. ROLLING BUFFER (crash-safe baseline):
   - On every activity write, also update `.hello-world/buddy-recap.json` with last ~10 items
   - Always fresh, survives crashes, costs nothing

2. AI SUMMARY ON CLEAN EXIT:
   - Tauri `on_window_event(CloseRequested)` spawns detached Node subprocess
   - Subprocess reads the buffer, calls AI to summarize into bulleted list, overwrites buddy-recap.json
   - Detached (survives app close), writes result before exiting

3. BUDDY CHAT BUBBLE UI:
   - On next app launch, buddy reads buddy-recap.json
   - Shows summary in pixel-art chat box above buddy's head
   - Typewriter text fill effect + chat sound effects (reuse deliberation sounds)
   - Project-scoped (tied to .hello-world/ in project folder)

4. DISPLAY LOGIC:
   - If AI summary exists (clean exit) -> show polished bullets
   - If only raw buffer exists (crash) -> format raw activity into bullets
   - If no file exists (first launch) -> buddy says welcome message

tasks.title: Fix all fallout from state.json split -- full system audit and optimization
tasks.description:
The state.json -> split files migration was incomplete. Fix everything:

1. ENOENT fix: Find and update all references to the old state.json path (session-start hook, MCP server, Rust commands)
2. Rust read cache: Add TTL-based file cache in lib.rs so multiple components reading the same file within 2-3s get cached results instead of hitting disk
3. Shared polling: Replace per-hook 10s intervals in useTauriData.ts with a single global 30s heartbeat that deduplicates
4. File watcher debounce: When MCP writes 3 files rapidly, batch the watcher events so components re-render once, not 3 times
5. Verify all hooks work with split files: session-start, pre-tool-gate, user-prompt-submit, post-edit-context
6. Test the full flow end-to-end

This is cleanup debt from the B+ state storage decision. Should have been caught during the original migration.
